intro: Gilia calothyrsa, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically blue to purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is known for its rapid growth cycle and ability to bloom quickly after rainfall.
